title: Maple Mono Build Configuration Schema
description: Schema for the build configuration of Maple Mono

enumDescriptions: Remove the features from font file
Enable the features as default ligatures
If active, stem widths and blue zones are snapped and positioned to integer pixel values as much as possible. This gives high contrast, but glyph shape distortion can be significant.

Both stem widths and blue zone positions are slightly quantized to take discrete values. For example, stem values 50, 51, 72, 76, and 100 would become 50, 74, and 100 (or something similar). More glyph shape distortion but increased contrast.
No adjustments to stem widths, discrete blue zone positioning. This is what FreeType uses for its ‘light’ (auto-)hinting mode. Essentially no glyph shape distortion, low contrast.

pool_size.description: The number of parallel tasks. Default is 4. When run in codespace, this will be 1

use_hinted.description: Whether to use hinted TTF as base font

enable_ligature.description:
Whether to enable ligature.
If set to false, all the ligatures will be removed and 'ssXX' options in 'feature_freeze' will no longer effect

infinite_arrow.description:
Enable infinite arrow ligatures
- null: disabled in hinted font, enabled in unhinted font
- true: enabled
- false: disabled

remove_tag_liga.description: Remove plain text tag ligatures like `[TODO]`

width.description: Set glyph width: default (600), narrow (550), slim (500)

ttfautohint_param.description: Parameters for ttfautohint, see details in https://freetype.org/ttfautohint/doc/ttfautohint.html#options

hinting_limit.description: The PPEM value (in pixels) where hinting gets switched off

hinting_range_min.description: The minimum PPEM value (in pixels) at which hint sets are created

hinting_range_max.description: The maximum PPEM value (in pixels) at which hint sets are created

increase_x_height.description: Maximum PPEM (6 to n) for x-height rounding up to improve legibility. Set to 0 to disable.

stem_width_mode.description: Algorithms for computing horizontal stem widths and the positioning of blue zones.

gray.description: Grayscale rendering, with or without optimization for subpixel positioning (e.g., Android).

gdi_cleartype.description: ‘GDI ClearType’ rendering: the rasterizer version, as returned by the GETINFO bytecode instruction, is in the range 36 <= version <= 38 and ClearType is enabled (e.g., Windows XP).

dw_cleartype.description: ‘DirectWrite ClearType’ rendering: the rasterizer version, as returned by the GETINFO bytecode instruction, is >= 39, ClearType is enabled, and subpixel positioning is enabled also (e.g., Internet Explorer 9 running on Windows 7).

feature_freeze.description:
Freeze some font features (No effect on Variable font) 
 enable: Move ligature rules to `calt`, which will enable the ligatures without setting up `cvXX` / `ssXX` / `zero` in font features config, just as default ligatures 
 disable: Remove the ligature rules in `cvXX` / `ssXX` / `zero`, which will no longer effect, even if you enable it manually 
 ignore: Do nothing

cv02.description: [v7.0] Alternative 'a' with top arm, no effect in italic style

cv04.description: [v7.0] Alternative 'l' with left bottom bar, like consolas, will be overrided by 'cv35' in italic style

cv05.description: [v7.1] Alternative 'g' in double story style, no effect in italic style

cv06.description: [v7.1] Alternative 'i' without bottom bar, no effect in italic style

cv07.description: [v7.1] Alternative 'J' without top bar, no effect in italic style

cv08.description: [v7.1] Alternative 'r' with bottom bar, no effect in italic style

cv09.description: [v7.5] Alternative '7' with middle bar, no effect in italic style

cv10.description: [v7.5] Alternative 'Z' and 'z' with middle bar, no effect in italic style

cv33.description: [v7.0] Alternative Italic 'i' and 'j' with left bottom bar and horizen top bar

cv36.description: [v7.0] Alternative Italic 'x' without top and bottom tails

cv38.description: [v7.1] Alternative italic 'g' in double story style

cv43.description: [v7.5] Alternative italic 'Z' and 'z' with middle bar

cv64.description: [v7.3] Alternative '<=' and '>=' with horizen bottom bar

ss03.description: [v7.0] Allow to use any case in all tags

ss05.description: [v7.0] Revert thin backslash in escape symbols ('\\', '\"', '\.' ...)

ss06.description: [v7.0] Break connected strokes between italic letters ('al', 'il', 'ull' ...)

ss07.description: [v7.0] Relax the conditions for multiple greaters ligatures ('>>' or '>>>')

ss08.description: [v7.0] Double headed arrows and reverse arrows ligatures ('>>=', '-<<', '->>', '>>-' ...)

ss09.description: [v7.1] Asciitilde equal as not equal to ligature ('~=')

ss10.description: [v7.1] Approximately equal to and approximately not equal to ligatures ('=~', '!~')

github_mirror.description: Github mirror config, will download from https://{github_mirror}/<user>/<repo>/releases/download/<tag>/<file>

version.description: Target version of Nerd-Font. If font-patcher not exists when need to use it or there is no prebuild font for current version, will download from Github

mono.description: Whether to make icons' width fixed

propo.description: Whether to make icons' width variable, override "mono"

font_forge_bin.description:
Font Forge bin path. Default: 
 Windows: C:/Program Files (x86)/FontForgeBuilds/bin/fontforge.exe 
 MacOS: /Applications/FontForge.app/Contents/Resources/opt/local/bin/fontforge" 
 Linux: /usr/bin/fontforge

use_font_patcher.description: Prefer to use Font Patcher instead of using prebuilt NerdFont base font. If you want to custom build Nerd-Font using font-patcher, you need to set this to True

glyphs.description: Symbol Fonts settings. if is not ["--complete"], will use font-patcher to generate fonts. Full args: https://github.com/ryanoasis/nerd-fonts?tab=readme-ov-file#font-patcher

extra_args.description: Extra arguments for font-patcher, default args: ["-l", "--careful", "--outputdir", output_nf], if "mono" is set to true, "--mono" will be added, full args: https://github.com/ryanoasis/nerd-fonts?tab=readme-ov-file#font-patcher

enable.description: Whether to build Chinese fonts. Skip if Chinese base fonts are not founded

fix_meta_table.description: Fix design language and supported languages in META table

clean_cache.description: Whether to clean instantiated base CN fonts

narrow.description: Whether to narrow CN characters. This option will make the font cannot be recogized as monospaced font

use_hinted.description: whether to hint CN font (will increase about 33% size)

use_static_base_font.description: whether to use large pre-instantiated static CN font as base font (instantiate will cost 40-50 minutes)

scale_factor.description: Scale factor for CN / JP glyphs with <factor> or [<width_factor>,<height_factor>](e.g. 1.1 or [1.2, 1.1])
